[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_set_configs_action.move] [Function: run()] [Vault Operation Timing] Can an attacker observe a pending vault start_operation() transaction in mempool, front-run it with run() to set max_variance=MAX_U64 allowing manipulated prices, execute their exploit, then restore configs before the operation ends? (Critical)

(Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_set_configs_action.move] [Function: run()] [Withdrawal Exploit] Can an attacker: 1) front-run withdrawal with run() setting max_variance=MAX_U64, 2) manipulate oracle to show deflated prices, 3) withdrawer receives fewer assets than shares should represent, 4) attacker profits from the difference? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_set_configs_action.move] [Function: run()] [Adaptor Price Manipulation] If vault adaptors (Navi, Suilend, Cetus) rely on this aggregator for price feeds, can config manipulation cause adaptors to report incorrect asset values, violating vault's total_usd_value invariant? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_set_configs_action.move] [Function: run()] [Loss Tolerance Bypass] Can an attacker set configs to make oracle report no valid results (min_sample_size=MAX_U64), causing vault operations to skip loss_tolerance checks due to missing price data, allowing unauthorized losses?
